text: The 2017 Rhode Island Rams football team represented the University of Rhode Island in the 2017 NCAA Division I FCS football season. They were led by fourth-year head coach Jim Fleming and played their home games at Meade Stadium. They were a member of the Colonial Athletic Association. They finished the season 3–8, 2–6 in CAA play to finish in a tie for tenth place. ==Schedule== *Source: Schedule ==Game summaries== ===at Central Michigan=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | colspan=3| First meeting |} ===Stony Brook=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–4 | 2016 | L, 3–14 |} ===Harvard=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 0–2 | 2016 | L, 21–51 |} ===at New Hampshire=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 28–58–5 | 2016 | L, 17–39 |} ===at Brown=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 27–72–2 | 2016 | W, 28–13 |} ===at Maine=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 34–58–3 | 2016 | L, 21–28 |} ===Elon=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–0 | 2016 | W, 44–14 |} ===at Albany=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 1–3 | 2016 | L, 7–35 |} ===James Madison=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 3–9 | 2016 | L, 7–84 |} ===Villanova=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 8–24 | 2016 | L, 0–35 |} ===at Towson=== {| class="wikitable" |- align="center" |- align="center" | 7–9 | 2016 | L, 31–32 |} ==References== Rhode Island Category:Rhode Island Rams football seasons Rhode Island Rams football
